TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit TransformPattern/TransformPatternInformation extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Provides access to the property values of a object using its or accessors.
Docs.related: UI Automation Control Patterns for Clients

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CanMove As Boolean
public: property bool CanMove { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether the UI Automation element can be moved.
Docs.value: if the element can be moved; otherwise .

remarks.format:
## Remarks An object cannot be moved, resized or rotated such that its resulting screen location would be completely outside the coordinates of its container and inaccessible to keyboard or mouse. For example, when a top-level window is moved completely off-screen or a child object is moved outside the boundaries of the container's viewport. In these cases the object is placed as close to the requested screen coordinates as possible with the top or left coordinates overridden to be within the container boundaries.
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TransformPattern> control pattern is obtained from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> and subsequently used to move the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
:::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATransformPattern_snip/CSharp/UIATransformPattern_snippets.cs" id="Snippet101"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATransformPattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIATransformPattern_snippets.vb" id="Snippet101"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATransformPattern_snip/CSharp/UIATransformPattern_snippets.cs" id="Snippet103"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIATransformPattern_snip/VisualBasic/UIATransformPattern_snippets.vb" id="Snippet103":::

remarks.format:
## Remarks An object cannot be moved, resized, or rotated such that its resulting screen location would be completely outside the coordinates of its container and inaccessible to keyboard or mouse. For example, when a top-level window is moved completely off-screen or a child object is moved outside the boundaries of the container's viewport. In these cases the object is placed as close to the requested screen coordinates as possible with the top or left coordinates overridden to be within the container boundaries.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An object cannot be moved, resized, or rotated such that its resulting screen location would be completely outside the coordinates of its container and inaccessible to keyboard or mouse. For example, when a top-level window is moved completely off-screen or a child object is moved outside the boundaries of the container's viewport. In these cases the object is placed as close to the requested screen coordinates as possible with the top or left coordinates overridden to be within the container boundaries.
## Examples In the following example, a <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TransformPattern> control pattern is obtained from an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement> and subsequently used to rotate the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement>.
